Item hierarchies are defined using the attributes of the items. Item Hierarchy is a system that is used to describe the different levels of an item category. You can create, view, or edit the various available item hierarchy levels on this page. By default, there is one 'Primary' hierarchy defined in the system. Users can define any number of item hierarchies.

This will provide the ability to manage certain configurations for a logical group of items rather than for individual items.

  Eg. “Store 1” is “A Grade” store for all items under “Department 1”

The hierarchy structure with parent-child relationship(Nodes) details does not persist. It is dynamically derived when it is used in different allocation processes/workflows. Hence, when there is a change to the hierarchy definition when the subsequent processes run next time, it will use the new definition. Other than that, there is no impact.

Creating an Item Hierarchy

 

To create a new item hierarchy:

 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item > Item Hierarchies
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Item Hierarchy window.
  4. Enter the Item Hierarchy and Description.
  5.  Click Save.
Note: All mandatory fields are denoted with *.

Editing an ItemHierarchy

 

To edit an item hierarchy:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item > Item Hierarchies
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required hierarchy record. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the Item Hierarchy window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save to save the modified hierarchy details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required policy record card. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the Item Hierarchy window, and modify the required fields.
  3. Click Save to save the modified hierarchy details.

 

Deleting an Item Hierarchy

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Item > Item Hierarchies
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  4. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Item Hierarchy is irreversible'.
  5. Click Yes to delete the policy.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Item Hierarchy is irreversible'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the policy.

 

Field Description

The following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

 

Description

 
Item Hierarchy Specifies the item hierarchy name.
Description The description of the hierarchy.
Created By Mentions the name of the user who created the item hierarchy.
Created Timestamp Specifies the date and time of the creation of the item hierarchy.

 

Action Buttons

The following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Select All Rows Selects all the rows of records on the screen.
Export Exports the list of item hierarchy attributes, and the file will be downloaded onto your system. View Export for more information.
Create Opens the Item Hierarchy window. 
Deselect Clears the selected records.
Details Opens the Item Hierarchy window displaying details of the selected record.
Edit Opens the Item Hierarchy window for editing the selected record.
Delete Deletes the selected record.
